1.content:
Nick was kneeling by his bed as he finished saying his prayers. Nick's deep baritone voice whispered as he prayed, "...and that you will please keep my Granny safe, alive, happy, and healthy..."

Despite the fact that Nick was seventeen and would turn eighteen in a few months, he still prayed every night and had never lost his faith in Christ. Nick had more or less succeed in controlling his more human impulses, and had done his best to spread the word of god but with him being an outcast at school he had not done many.

As Nick prayed he did not hear the sound of someone climbing up the side of the house on the ivy his mother had been letting grow there for ages, the man looked in and saw Nick praying and smiled as he quietly picked the lock on the window.

Nick was reaching the final part of his prayer and quietly prayed, "Lord if to be your will, when I die I ask that you will please reincarnate me as a dragon. For you know I have always loved them almost as much as I love you and ask that before I join you in heaven that I may spend a lifetime as a dragon here on Earth, so before I say goodnight my lord I will listen for your voice. So if you have anything to say to me I ask that you say it now for I am listening.

Nick suddenly felt a knife blade pressed up against his throat and smelled a man who smelled of beer and sweat behind him.

"If you have anything else to add to your prayers boy you would best say them now," the man said chuckling softly.

Nick remained silent, and the man sliced open Nick's throat, and as Nick died he breathed the words, "Amen."

The man chuckled and turned to look for something worth stealing in the kids room. Unfortunately, Nick had never been very tidy, and the man stepped on an old toy that rolled and and stumbled backwards. The man stepped on one of the clay models of a Dragon Nick had made in art class, this one had a long sharp spin the pierced the man's shoe and made him hop on one foot cursing. The man then stepped on Nick's old Hotwheels that he had never gotten around, but gave away and slipped completely off his feet cracking his head on the open window.

Now completely limp the man sagged out the window falling twenty feet and cracked his head open on the ground below. Nick's father came in to see what all the noise was and saw his son dead, and bleeding onto the bed his hands still folded in prayer. Nick's father was at a loss for words and only hoped Nick was in a better place now.

Little did he know that god had granted Nick's final prayer as a reward for his lifetime of devotion, even if it were short.
1.title: A tragic prayer

11.content:
Nick felt himself die and almost instantly felt warmth return to his body and wondered if he would be ascending into heaven. Nick tried to move, but his body seemed unresponsive at the moment, and he tried to figure out what was happening, but without any senses it was impossible.

Nick waited and soon felt his senses returning to him and found himself

112.content:
Nick woke up and saw that he was sleeping in a pile of young dragons and carefully slid to the bottom of the pile trying hard not to wake any of the dragons. Nick felt overjoyed seeing dragons, but being this close to them when they woke up might be a problem since they might not like humans to much. Nick moved as quietly towards the front of the cave to see just where he was freezing when he heard movement behind him.

"Where are you going Zash?" a feminine voice asked behind him.

Nick slowly turned his head to look behind himself and saw that a dragon that seemed to tower over him was looking down at him from behind the pile. Nick had no doubt that this dragon was the mother of the other dragons, but why had it called him Zash?

"Zash do not think that if you just hold still I won't see you," the dragon said an edge coming into its voice, "I am your mother and I want to know where you think you're going to this hour."

Nick jumped a bit hearing the mother dragon refer to him as his mother. That is when Nick notices that he was walking on all fours, he had been so intent on moving quietly he had not noticed it before. He also noticed he had a long tail, light green scales, and wings there was no mistaking it, Nick was now a dragon.

Nick crowed happily and practically danced on his four tiny feet as he realized this and jumped a foot in the air when the mother dragon shouted, "Zash, just what are you doing!?!"

Nick noticed that the shout had woken up what appeared to be his new brothers and sisters. Nick thought hastily and said, "Its a beautiful morning, and I thought I might go warm myself in the sun."

"Hmph, why didn't you just tell me," his mother said rustling her wings, "I thought you where going to go try to see humans again."

Nick took note that humans where still alive whenever he was and apparently close. Nick walked out of the cave and looked around and saw he was...
112.title: Awoken in a cave

choices: Fly away from here, but can't.
1122.content:
Nick looked out over the forest outside of the cave he had been in and smiled at the familiar view. He had come to this cave when he was ten and searches the forest for any signs of dragons. He had come to this cave and looked around. The mother dragon obviously had not been living here then, but he had looked over his town just a mile away from here. Nick could see that it has not changed at all since he had been reborn.

Nick spotted his house and focusing could see both of his parents' cars. As well as his own still parked out front, it had obviously been a very short time since he had died and it might even be within the same week. Nick was about to move closer to his home when he felt a heavy weight push him to the ground, and saw his new mother had put one of her feet on him and was smiling down at him.

"You're not going anywhere Zash," his mother said smiling, "You haven't been alive two days, but you have been trying to head over to that human city. I keep telling you that the city is extremely dangerous and full of humans who will try to kill you or capture you. Humans are not friendly creatures and are constantly attacking each other just for the hell of it. You're not allowed to go near that city, ever!"

"I understand mother," Nick said meekly looking down at the ground, "I will not go near the human city."

"Good now why don't you go play with your brothers and sisters?" Nick's mother asked to start to turn back to the cave.

Nick...

Dressed in their normal clothes, reality changed.
11223.content:
Nick quickly dove off the edge of the rise the cave was on down into the forest. He heard his mother yell and call out for him to return immediately or he would be in big trouble. Nick didn't like the idea of an angry dragon chasing him, but he saw little choice in the matter, he had to see his old family one last time.

Nick could hear his mother crashing through the woods after him and Nick turned off running under a tangle of thorns. Nick heard his mother get caught in them with an irritated hiss and ran through a large growth of ferns. Nick managed to avoid sneezing as the fronds tickled his sensitive nose, and ran across a rocky patch of ground that would hides his trail and serves as a short cut to his home.

"ZASH!!!" Nick heard his mother screech from above.

Nick doubled his speed and made it between to close growing trees before his mother could try to scope him up. Nick knew his mother had taken to the air when she had lost his trail in the ferns, and that now it was dangerous to move out in the open.

Nick soon arrived at his street looking at the distance he must cross in order to make it home. Nick could see his mother circling high above so as to be mistakable for a bird and knew that she would not come closer here for fear of getting seen by humans, or so he hoped.

Nick quickly dashed across the street and into on of his neighbors bushes moving through them around until he leapt into one of the trees in his front yard. Nick froze as he heard the door open and turned to see his family walking out of the house. Nick noticed that they were...
11223.title: Escape from your dragon mother!

112231.content:
Nick saw his family walking out of his home dressed in black as he had only seen them do one two other occasions, when his pet Pitbull had died and when his grandmother had died. Nick knew that the only person who had died recently was him, unless his death had caused someone else to die.

Nick watched his family climb into the car that his mother seemed to be crying, and his father was grim faced as always. His brother, on the other hand, seemed to be particularly happy as he thumbed through Nick's CD collection. Nick nearly growled in anger seeing his brother doing this and was glad that his will had given his brother nothing.

Nick and his little brother had never gotten along well, and it seemed nick's death had done nothing to change this.

Nick waited until everyone had climbed into the car before he dropped from the tree and scrambled under the car and held onto the underside. Nick heard the car rumble and pressed himself as flat as possible to keep from getting scraped across the ground.

Nick held on for almost twenty minutes feeling the wind tearing past him and the car heating up to painful temperatures. After that the car came to a stop and Nick peaked out and saw that they were at his granny's house. Nick dropped off the car and blew his feet to try and cool them off.

Nick saw his parents head inside to pick up his granny, and he quickly ran into the car and hides behind the back seat. Nick waited a few minutes, and as his family climbed back into the car, he saw his granny had...
112231.title: Dressed in black, with sad look on their faces.

1122312.content:
Nick saw his granny climb into the car and saw that her eyes were red and puffy and that she wore a huge frown on her face.

Nick surprised of that because his granny had always seemed to such a happy and delighted person. In all the years, he had known her he could not once remember her crying, not even when either of her husbands had died. Then Nick remembers, she had always seemed particularly happy to be with him and smiled when he tried new things around her or went somewhere with her. Nick finally realized that he just might have been her favorite despite him being the middle child.

Nick was completely silent as was everything else in the car except his brother who was contently listening to one of nick's favorite CDs. Despite the fact, Nick's dream had come true he was starting to feel sad about his death because everyone else, his brother excluded, seemed to be sad about his passing.

It was about one hour drive to the morgue where everyone left the car and Nick waited a moment before unlocking the door and heading...
1122312.title: Poor granny

11223122.content:
Nick desperately wanted to go into the morgue and hear what people were saying to his corpse. However, Nick knew that it would be far too crowded for him to try and sneak into the room his body was resting in its coffin. Nick also knew from experience that the door he would have to open to get to his old body was in plain view of the whole room, but a round knob is too difficult for him to open.

Nick ran out into the graveyard and hides behind the tombstones before carefully looking around and using all of his senses to make sure no one was near him. Nick spotted an open grave and knew that was where he would be buried in there and creeps over to a nearby tree, waited for the funeral procession to exit the building. Nick eyed the sky, see his mother still circling overhead obviously afraid to draw closer seeing the scattered human that was working at preparing Nick's grave sight.

Nick waited for close to an hour and started to get hungry when...
11223122.title: The church

A mother dragon comes down, asking for a reason.
112231221.content:
Nick spotted a line of three limos driving slowly down a narrow paved path that led by his grave. The limos stopped, and the first carried Nick's coffin out and carried it over to the grave where it has suspended above the grave itself. The other two limos deposited Nick's large and scattered family from his half sister Jessica and her boyfriend to a dozen relatives. Nick only knew existed because he had seen them at family gatherings.

Nick's family took a seat at the numerous chairs the were place in front of the coffin and looked either at the coffin or the priest standing in front of it. Nick saw faces ranging from stony and anguished to some crying on shoulders and his brother's beaming face. Nick didn't think he has ever seen that little brat so happy in his life.

The priest opened his book and began to mutter something from his bible that Nick tried, and failed, to hear what the priest said. The priest spokes about a minute before he closed his bible, bowed, and walked away from the coffin. Several of the less affected relatives and Nick's brother walked away with the priest as Nick's coffin has slowly lowered into the grave, and the grave diggers removed the straps to begin to fill the grave.

Nick waited in his tree as his family milled about the grave talking and weeping, telling each other moments they remembered of him, or cried at the lack of them. A few of the younger more distant relatives simply looked bored and as they wanted to leave. Nick saw his younger brother come by and all but danced as he fingered one of Nick's CDs.

Nick quickly looked around to make sure no one was looking and propelled himself at his brother's back and drove him to the ground, snatching up his CD. Nick quickly ran back up the tree and hid high up where his green scales acted as camo. The whole thing had taken about two seconds, and Nick's brother looked around for who had knocked him down and saw no one was nearby and that the CD vanished without a trace.

Nick's brother's face contorted in horror as he looked around and ran to the brightest spot he could find. Nick chuckled softly as he watched his brother. He seemed to think that Nick had been so stubborn and possessive that he had come back as a ghost to reclaim what was his. Nick thought that if he had not been reborn he just might have forced himself to become a ghost for similar reasons.

Soon everyone had left the grave sight. Nick hopped out of his tree and walked over to his grave looking at it and thinking that it was HIS grave. Nick sat there for a moment before..
112231221.title: The funeral

1122312212.content:
Nick heard the flap of wings and a heavy thud. He knew that his mother had just landed behind him and probably pissed. Yet he still continued looking at his grave thinking about what it meant to the people who didn't know what had happened. Not only that but Nick knew his few friends now all probably thought he was dead. Nick also cursed the fact he had only recently gotten a new game, and had not been able to play through it before he had died.

"Zash what the hell is wrong with you!?!" Nick's mother hissed angrily behind him scanning for any nearby humans, "I told you to stay away from humans and not only have you disobeyed me in that, but you followed a group to one of their rituals and even attacked one! Do have any idea. That how lucky you are, that your not dead!?!"

Nick remained silent as he looked at his grave and tore one of the scales out of his tail and placed it up against the tombstone.

"Zash you better tell me right now why you did all of this or, you will not be eating until winter!" Nick's mother shouted.

"Nick," Nick said quietly.

"What does that mean?" Nick's mother asked to sound confused.

"You keep calling me Zash, but my name is Nick," Nick said looking at the tombstone, "Or to be more exact Nicholas James Birnchett. I was the one who would be buried, here and those humans where my family."

"Zash is this another one of your pretend games!?!" Nick's mother asked hissing angrily, "Well listen to me! you are a dragon, not a human! So stay the hell away from them or they will kill you!"

"No," Nick said, "Your wrong, I am and I'm not a human."

"You expect me to believe this!?!" Nick's mother hissed, "I laid your egg and watched you hatch I know you are completely dragon in nature."

"In body yes," Nick said, "In mind and soul no."

Nick's mother...
1122312212.title: Nick's in big trouble

choices: She think of Nick as a freak! She abandons her child
She believes and never abandon her child.
11223122122.content:
"What are you talking about?" She replied "You had better explain yourself and quick before human spots us."

"In my past life, I was a human," Nick explained, "In fact I was the human I'm standing above right now. My real name is Nicholas James Birnchett. Two nights ago, I was still human, and I prayed that when I died, I would be reincarnated as a dragon. As a human, I always like dragons, and always wanted to be one or at least meet one. That night I get murdered, and now I'm a dragon."

The female dragon has gotten perplexed by what Nick was saying to her. She had heard of powerful magic before, but she never heard of something that could transfer a human's soul into a dragon's body. "This can't be possible! I saw you hatch from your egg. I laid your egg and everything," the dragon protested.

"Don't you think it is odd that Nick died the same day I hatched?" Nick asked, "It says the date of Nick's death right there." Nick pointed at the place on the tombstone.

The dragon stared at the tombstone and said, "You know that dragons can't read anything human, and neither can you."

"But I can, because I was once human. I then become reincarnated as a dragon, but I remember everything from my human life," Nick replied.

Nick stared at the tombstone for a while before saying, "I wanted to be a dragon so badly that I made a deal with God to reincarnate me as a dragon when I died. However, I thought that I would die of old age or something. I didn't think I would die at the age of seventeen. My family and my friends are all still alive. They think I'm dead, and I can't tell them otherwise. I don't think I can speak English now because I'm a dragon, and even if I can, they won't believe me. I never imagined that things would be like this."

Nick began to cry, and the female dragon was beginning to believe her child. The baby dragon was no more than two days old, but it seemed to have the mind of a matured individual. There might have been some truth in the bizarre story.

What does the dragon do?
11223122122.title: Wants to know why?

choices: Nick's human mother visit his tombstone
112231221222.content:
Nick's mother feels conflicted about what to do as she saw what she thought was her child weeping on the ground. Zash had said a completely unknown name to her, but it was defiantly a human name which he would have been unable to learn without at least being able to understand the human language, which she couldn't. Nick or Zash didn't act like a human, yet he seemed peaceful, and only a bit unpredictable while humans were violent and completely random.

Still she could not find it in herself to cast away a child that had hatched from one of her eggs, even if it seemed to be possessed by a human.

Nick's mother moved forward and wrapped one wing around her child after making sure the area was still clear of humans. Nick continued to weep for a few seconds before he looked up at his mother and said, "It would seem you haven't abandoned me at least."

"I'm not sure I fully understand what you have told me," Nick's mother said soothingly, "But whatever it means you are my child now and dragons do not abandon their children as humans do."

"I had theorized as much," Nick said sighing, "I have just one more thing to do before we can go."

"Fine but make it quick," Nick's mother said looking around nervously, "I hate to be in a place where I might be spotted by a human any second."

Nick walk to the tombstone and above the scale he had placed there used one of his claws to carve, "Alive and free."

Nick walked back to his newest mother, and she asked, "What did you carve there?"

"Something that could take some of the pain out of death for my family." Nick said as his mother picked him gently up with her mouth.

Nick's mother grunted and took to the air flying back to the cave and the rest of her children.

What happened next?

Nick was outside staring off into the sky like he was in a deep trance that nothing could make it loosen its hold. Nick's (should I say dragon) mother having come out of the cave to check on him. He's been staring off into space for quit some time. Mean while...
A strange man wearing a dark hood who's running for his life. "Do these guys ever quit? They been chasing me for hours." Sounds of guns being fired. "Shit they have guns." He runs out into the open onto the edge of a cliff. "Oh no dead end." Sound of a gun being prepared. "Don't even move." The hooded figure raises his hands and slowly turns around to see 5 men 2 having shot guns 2 with rifles 4 of them were wearing masks concealing their faces. The final man wasn't you could see a scar over his brown eye. He had a revolver. "Where do you think your going with my necklace." He said in a deep raspy voice. "Your necklace? First of all this is a pendent. Second of all you stole this from me just last week. Third of all you don't know what its truely for." Looses his balance falling off the edge into the fog below. The man with the scar looked over the edge to see nothing but fog. "No man could survive a fall like that."
Back at the cave... Nick was still staring at the sky. Until he was pulled aside by his mother. This is where the hoodied man landed passed out. "Where did he come from?" Nick was surprised to be seeing what he thought was a body of a dead man. The man soon began to stir. "Uh how am I not dead." Before he quickly passed out. Nick got wide eyed he knew he has hear this voice before he just wasn't sure where. "I swear I know this person from some where. I just can't remember where. Wait it can't be." The hood hiding the mans face is removed. "I can't believe its him. I thought he was dead." "And who is he then?" "His name is Seth. But why is he here?"

info.brief_description: A teen boy who prayed has been murdered, but reincarnated into a dragon.
info.description:
I'm sorry for stealing their ideas. I sick of waiting for Dragonlord to respond.

This story starts as a seventeen year old boy named: Nicholas Birnchett saying his prayer and prays that when he dies, he may resurrects as a dragon. A man who decideds to rob his house hears this and does the killing part happily.

Aftermath, Nick wakes up as a dragon, but how much time has passed and how long will it take him to grow enough to remember is unknown. Nick will have all of his memories of his human life once the story enters that part of his dragon life, he might of not be born with his memories. What happens to Nick can vary since he could be born the next day to millions of years later after man has left.

If you got touchy by the words God, Jehovah, Reincarnation, or death, this story is not for you so turn around and don't let the door hit you on the way out.

The ground rules are...

Nick may vore people, but he needs a very good reason and will not do so happily or enthusiastically, only regular vore.

Nick does not have to be reborn as a male.

Nick may or may not be able to speak English as a dragon but will always be able to use jesters and crude writing.

Nick's dragon form may be shaped like that of a western Dragon, but he can be reborn anywhere on Earth (and only Earth).

The behavior of humans or what might have replaced them depends on the timeline. They may be curious and inquisitive or terrified to down right hostile.

Nick's attitude is that of an outcast who is willing to make friends but rather cautious, though he is more than willing to talk of his abilities and past.

Forgot to mention this earlier but the second chapter should be about how old Nick now is and possibly his gender.

Happy writing!
